Requirement Statement: The ollama-executor custom agent SHALL be defined at ADR-2025-022-ollama-executor-custom-agent.md; .github/agents/ollama-executor.agent.md and contain a valid name and description in the YAML frontmatter.
Acceptance Criteria: Agent file exists at ADR-2025-022-ollama-executor-custom-agent.md; .github/agents/ollama-executor.agent.md with valid YAML frontmatter containing name and description fields.
Agent Procedure (step-by-step): Open ADR-2025-022-ollama-executor-custom-agent.md; .github/agents/ollama-executor.agent.md and verify the frontmatter contains name: ollama-executor and a non-empty description.
Evidence to Collect: Agent file content showing YAML frontmatter with name and description fields.
Notes: Agent frontmatter defines the custom agent identity for GitHub Copilot.
Rationale: Provides machine-readable agent identity for integration with GitHub Copilot.
Risk: Risk: missing/malformed frontmatter breaks agent activation; mitigated by inspection.
Assumptions: Assumes GitHub custom agents format per https://gh.io/customagents/config.
Constraints: .agent.md extension required; name SHALL match intended agent identifier.
Verification Detail: Inspection: verify ADR-2025-022-ollama-executor-custom-agent.md; .github/agents/ollama-executor.agent.md exists with valid YAML frontmatter.

Requirement Statement: The ollama-executor agent SHALL document capabilities for source distribution builds including LabVIEW version and bitness parameters.
Acceptance Criteria: Agent documentation includes Run-Locked-SourceDistribution.ps1 usage with -LabVIEWVersion and -Bitness parameters.
Agent Procedure (step-by-step): Review agent markdown for source distribution build section showing complete command syntax with version and bitness options.
Evidence to Collect: Agent markdown excerpt showing source distribution command examples.
Notes: Documents agent capability to drive source distribution builds for multiple LabVIEW targets.
Rationale: Enables users to invoke source distribution builds via the agent.
Risk: Risk: incomplete documentation leads to incorrect usage; mitigated by inspection.
Assumptions: Assumes Run-Locked-SourceDistribution.ps1 exists with documented parameters.
Constraints: Commands SHALL use pwsh -NoProfile -File scripts/... pattern.
Verification Detail: Inspection: verify agent documents Run-Locked-SourceDistribution.ps1 with version/bitness params.

Requirement Statement: The ollama-executor agent SHALL document capabilities for package builds via the locked executor.

Verification Detail: Inspection: verify agent documents Run-Locked-PackageBuild.ps1 with endpoint/model params.

Requirement Statement: The ollama-executor agent SHALL document capabilities for driving the full Ollama host orchestration workflow.
Acceptance Criteria: Agent documentation includes Run-Ollama-Host.ps1 usage with runKey and lock TTL parameters.
Agent Procedure (step-by-step): Review agent markdown for host orchestration section showing complete command syntax.
Evidence to Collect: Agent markdown excerpt showing host orchestration command examples.
Notes: Documents agent capability to drive host orchestration workflow.
Rationale: Enables users to invoke host orchestration via the agent.
Risk: Risk: incomplete documentation leads to incorrect usage; mitigated by inspection.
Assumptions: Assumes Run-Ollama-Host.ps1 exists with documented parameters.
Constraints: Commands SHALL use pwsh -NoProfile -File scripts/... pattern.

Requirement Statement: The ollama-executor agent SHALL document smoke test capabilities to validate Ollama connectivity.
Acceptance Criteria: Agent documentation includes smoke test usage with -SmokeOnly switch.
Agent Procedure (step-by-step): Review agent markdown for smoke test section showing -SmokeOnly switch usage.
Evidence to Collect: Agent markdown excerpt showing smoke test command examples.
Notes: Documents agent capability to run connectivity smoke tests.
Rationale: Enables quick validation of Ollama availability without full builds.
Risk: Risk: users attempt full builds without connectivity; mitigated by smoke test documentation.
Assumptions: Assumes Run-Ollama-Host.ps1 supports -SmokeOnly switch.
Constraints: Smoke tests SHALL complete within 300 seconds timeout.
Verification Detail: Inspection: verify agent documents -SmokeOnly smoke test mode.

Requirement Statement: The ollama-executor agent SHALL document test suite capabilities for command vetting and security fuzzing.
Acceptance Criteria: Agent documentation includes Test-CommandVetting.ps1 and Test-SecurityFuzzing.ps1 usage.
Agent Procedure (step-by-step): Review agent markdown for testing section showing test script commands.
Evidence to Collect: Agent markdown excerpt showing test command examples.
Notes: Documents agent capability to run security and vetting tests.
Rationale: Enables users to validate executor security before use.
Risk: Risk: untested security changes reach production; mitigated by test documentation.
Assumptions: Assumes test scripts exist and are executable.
Constraints: Tests SHALL run without Ollama server connection.
Verification Detail: Inspection: verify agent documents Test-CommandVetting.ps1 and Test-SecurityFuzzing.ps1.

Requirement Statement: The ollama-executor agent SHALL document environment variables for simulation mode including OLLAMA_EXECUTOR_MODE and OLLAMA_SIM_* variables.
Acceptance Criteria: Agent documentation includes all simulation environment variables with descriptions.
Agent Procedure (step-by-step): Review agent markdown for environment section listing OLLAMA_EXECUTOR_MODE=sim and related variables.
Evidence to Collect: Agent markdown excerpt showing environment variable documentation.
Notes: Documents simulation mode for CI/testing without LabVIEW.
Rationale: Enables testing and CI runs without real LabVIEW installation.
Risk: Risk: simulation mode used in production accidentally; mitigated by explicit env requirement.
Assumptions: Assumes simulation mode is triggered only by OLLAMA_EXECUTOR_MODE=sim.
Constraints: Simulation mode SHALL NOT invoke real LabVIEW processes.
Verification Detail: Inspection: verify agent documents OLLAMA_EXECUTOR_MODE and OLLAMA_SIM_* variables.

Requirement Statement: The ollama-executor agent SHALL document port configuration distinguishing real server (11435) from mock server (11436) usage.
Acceptance Criteria: Agent documentation includes port configuration section explaining 11435 for real server and 11436 for mock/testing.
Agent Procedure (step-by-step): Review agent markdown for port configuration section.
Evidence to Collect: Agent markdown excerpt showing port configuration documentation.
Notes: Documents port separation to avoid conflicts between real and mock servers.
Rationale: Prevents port conflicts during testing and production use.
Risk: Risk: port conflicts cause test/production failures; mitigated by clear documentation.
Assumptions: Assumes real Ollama uses 11435; mock uses 11436.
Constraints: Port numbers SHALL NOT overlap between real and mock servers.
Verification Detail: Inspection: verify agent documents port 11435 for real and 11436 for mock server.

Requirement Statement: The ollama-executor agent SHALL document security guardrails including allowlist-only command execution.
Acceptance Criteria: Agent documentation includes security guardrails section with allowlist enforcement description.
Agent Procedure (step-by-step): Review agent markdown for security section describing allowlist-only execution.
Evidence to Collect: Agent markdown excerpt showing allowlist documentation.
Notes: Documents allowlist security model for command execution.
Rationale: Prevents arbitrary command execution by LLM-driven workflows.
Risk: Risk: command injection if allowlist bypassed; mitigated by strict pattern matching.
Assumptions: Assumes allowlist is enforced at runtime by Test-CommandAllowed.
Constraints: Only pwsh -NoProfile -File scripts/...ps1 patterns allowed.
Verification Detail: Inspection: verify agent documents allowlist-only command execution.

Requirement Statement: The ollama-executor agent SHALL document path traversal prevention (../ patterns rejected).
Acceptance Criteria: Agent documentation includes path traversal prevention with test validation showing ../ rejection. Test suite includes path traversal test cases that pass.
Agent Procedure (step-by-step): Review agent markdown for path traversal section; run Test-CommandVetting.ps1 to confirm ../ rejection.
Evidence to Collect: Agent markdown excerpt plus test output showing path traversal rejection.
Notes: Documents path traversal protection.
Rationale: Prevents directory escape attacks via command parameters.
Risk: Risk: path traversal allows file system access outside repo; mitigated by pattern rejection.
Assumptions: Assumes ../ pattern detection is implemented in Test-CommandAllowed.
Constraints: Regex patterns SHALL catch both ../ and ..\\ variants.
Verification Detail: Inspection + Test: verify agent documents path traversal prevention and test suite validates it.

Requirement Statement: The ollama-executor agent SHALL document command chaining prevention (semicolons and pipes rejected).
Acceptance Criteria: Agent documentation includes command chaining prevention with test validation showing ; and | rejection. Test suite includes chaining test cases that pass.
Agent Procedure (step-by-step): Review agent markdown for command chaining section; run Test-CommandVetting.ps1 to confirm rejection.
Evidence to Collect: Agent markdown excerpt plus test output showing command chaining rejection.
Notes: Documents command chaining protection.
Rationale: Prevents command injection via chaining operators.
Risk: Risk: command chaining allows arbitrary code execution; mitigated by character rejection.
Assumptions: Assumes chaining character detection is implemented in Test-CommandAllowed.
Constraints: Pattern SHALL detect semicolon and pipe characters plus backticks.
Verification Detail: Inspection + Test: verify agent documents command chaining prevention and test suite validates it.

Requirement Statement: The ollama-executor agent SHALL document network tool blocking (wget/curl/nc rejected).
Acceptance Criteria: Agent documentation includes network tool blocking with test validation showing wget/curl rejection. Test suite includes network tool test cases that pass.
Agent Procedure (step-by-step): Review agent markdown for network tools section; run Test-CommandVetting.ps1 to confirm rejection.
Evidence to Collect: Agent markdown excerpt plus test output showing network tool rejection.
Notes: Documents network tool blocking.
Rationale: Prevents data exfiltration via network commands.
Risk: Risk: network tools enable data exfiltration; mitigated by tool name blocking.
Assumptions: Assumes forbidden token list includes network tool names.
Constraints: Pattern SHALL include wget/curl/nc/telnet/Invoke-WebRequest.
Verification Detail: Inspection + Test: verify agent documents network tool blocking and test suite validates it.

Requirement Statement: The ollama-executor agent SHALL document privilege escalation prevention (sudo/runas rejected).
Acceptance Criteria: Agent documentation includes privilege escalation prevention with test validation showing sudo/runas rejection. Test suite includes privilege test cases that pass.
Agent Procedure (step-by-step): Review agent markdown for privilege escalation section; run Test-CommandVetting.ps1 to confirm rejection.
Evidence to Collect: Agent markdown excerpt plus test output showing privilege escalation rejection.
Notes: Documents privilege escalation protection.
Rationale: Prevents elevation of privileges via command parameters.
Risk: Risk: privilege escalation compromises host security; mitigated by keyword blocking.
Assumptions: Assumes forbidden token list includes privilege elevation commands.
Constraints: Pattern SHALL include sudo/runas/ExecutionPolicy Bypass.
Verification Detail: Inspection + Test: verify agent documents privilege escalation prevention and test suite validates it.

Requirement Statement: The ollama-executor agent SHALL document timeout enforcement for commands with configurable CommandTimeoutSec.
Acceptance Criteria: Agent documentation includes timeout enforcement with CommandTimeoutSec parameter description.
Agent Procedure (step-by-step): Review agent markdown for timeout section describing configurable timeout.
Evidence to Collect: Agent markdown excerpt showing timeout configuration documentation.
Notes: Documents command timeout protection.
Rationale: Prevents hung commands from blocking workflow indefinitely.
Risk: Risk: hung commands block builds; mitigated by configurable timeout.
Assumptions: Assumes timeout enforcement is implemented in executor.
Constraints: Default timeout SHALL be reasonable (e.g. 600s) for build operations.
Verification Detail: Inspection: verify agent documents CommandTimeoutSec timeout enforcement.

Requirement Statement: The ollama-executor agent SHALL document workflow guidelines for verifying prerequisites before execution.
Acceptance Criteria: Agent documentation includes workflow guidelines section with prerequisite verification steps.
Agent Procedure (step-by-step): Review agent markdown for workflow guidelines with prereq verification.
Evidence to Collect: Agent markdown excerpt showing prerequisite verification steps.
Notes: Documents prerequisite verification workflow.
Rationale: Prevents execution failures due to missing dependencies.
Risk: Risk: builds fail due to missing prereqs; mitigated by verification steps.
Assumptions: Assumes check-ollama-endpoint.ps1 can validate Ollama availability.
Constraints: Prereq checks SHALL complete before build execution.
Verification Detail: Inspection: verify agent documents prerequisite verification steps.

Requirement Statement: The ollama-executor agent SHALL document mode selection guidance for simulation vs real execution.
Acceptance Criteria: Agent documentation includes mode selection guidance describing when to use simulation vs real mode.
Agent Procedure (step-by-step): Review agent markdown for mode selection guidance section.
Evidence to Collect: Agent markdown excerpt showing mode selection guidance.
Notes: Documents mode selection for different use cases.
Rationale: Helps users choose correct mode for their context.
Risk: Risk: wrong mode causes build failures or unintended actions; mitigated by clear guidance.
Assumptions: Assumes simulation mode works without LabVIEW installation.
Constraints: Real mode requires Windows runner with LabVIEW installed.
Verification Detail: Inspection: verify agent documents simulation vs real mode selection.

Requirement Statement: The ollama-executor agent SHALL document failure handling procedures including log locations for diagnostics.
Acceptance Criteria: Agent documentation includes failure handling section with log file locations.
Agent Procedure (step-by-step): Review agent markdown for failure handling with log path references.
Evidence to Collect: Agent markdown excerpt showing failure handling and log paths.
Notes: Documents failure handling for troubleshooting.
Rationale: Enables users to diagnose and resolve execution failures.
Risk: Risk: failures go undiagnosed; mitigated by log location documentation.
Assumptions: Assumes logs are written under reports/logs/ directory.
Constraints: Fail files SHALL include detection_point and error fields.
Verification Detail: Inspection: verify agent documents failure handling and log locations.

Requirement Statement: The ollama-executor agent SHALL document artifact locations including artifacts/ staging and builds-isolated/ run-scoped outputs.
Acceptance Criteria: Agent documentation includes artifact locations section listing all output directories.
Agent Procedure (step-by-step): Review agent markdown for artifacts section with directory paths.
Evidence to Collect: Agent markdown excerpt showing artifact location documentation.
Notes: Documents artifact locations for downstream consumption.
Rationale: Enables users to locate and consume build outputs.
Risk: Risk: artifacts not found; mitigated by clear path documentation.
Assumptions: Assumes artifact paths follow run-key scoped pattern.
Constraints: artifacts/ and builds-isolated/<runKey>/ are primary output roots.
Verification Detail: Inspection: verify agent documents artifacts/ and builds-isolated/ locations.

Requirement Statement: The ollama-executor agent SHALL document the handshake JSON artifact at artifacts/labview-icon-api-handshake.json.
Acceptance Criteria: Agent documentation includes handshake JSON artifact description with path and purpose.
Agent Procedure (step-by-step): Review agent markdown for handshake artifact documentation.
Evidence to Collect: Agent markdown excerpt showing handshake artifact documentation.
Notes: Documents handshake JSON for downstream consumers.
Rationale: Enables downstream workflows to consume build outputs with verification.
Risk: Risk: handshake missing breaks downstream flows; mitigated by documentation.
Assumptions: Assumes handshake JSON is generated on successful runs.
Constraints: Handshake SHALL include zipRelPath and sha256 fields.
Verification Detail: Inspection: verify agent documents labview-icon-api-handshake.json artifact.

Requirement Statement: The ollama-executor agent SHALL include reference links to ADR and testing documentation.
Acceptance Criteria: Agent documentation includes reference section with links to ADR-2025-017 and TESTING.md.
Agent Procedure (step-by-step): Review agent markdown for reference documentation links.
Evidence to Collect: Agent markdown excerpt showing reference documentation links.
Notes: Documents reference materials for deeper understanding.
Rationale: Enables users to understand design decisions and testing approach.
Risk: Risk: users lack context without reference links; mitigated by documentation.
Assumptions: Assumes ADR and TESTING.md documents exist and are current.
Constraints: Reference paths SHALL be relative to repository root.
Verification Detail: Inspection: verify agent includes ADR and testing documentation references.

Requirement Statement: The ollama-executor agent SHALL document the capability to prompt users for LabVIEW version (e.g., 2021, 2023, 2024, 2025) and bitness (32 or 64) before initiating a real build.
Acceptance Criteria: Agent documentation includes interactive build section with prompting guidance for version and bitness selection.
Agent Procedure (step-by-step): Review agent markdown for interactive build section showing user prompting workflow.
Evidence to Collect: Agent markdown excerpt showing version/bitness prompting guidance.
Notes: Documents interactive workflow for real LabVIEW builds.
Rationale: Enables agent to collect user preferences before modifying build configuration.
Risk: Risk: wrong version/bitness selected; mitigated by explicit user confirmation.
Assumptions: Assumes user knows which LabVIEW versions are installed on the runner.
Constraints: Supported versions: 2021-2025; bitness: 32 or 64.
Verification Detail: Inspection: verify agent documents user prompting for version and bitness.

Requirement Statement: The ollama-executor agent SHALL document the capability to modify the VIPB file to target a specific LabVIEW version and bitness using vipb-bump-worktree.ps1 or ModifyVIPBDisplayInfo.ps1.
Acceptance Criteria: Agent documentation includes VIPB modification commands with version and bitness parameters.
Agent Procedure (step-by-step): Review agent markdown for VIPB modification section showing script usage.
Evidence to Collect: Agent markdown excerpt showing VIPB modification commands.
Notes: Documents VIPB modification for targeting specific LabVIEW configurations.
Rationale: Enables agent to configure builds for user-specified LabVIEW targets.
Risk: Risk: VIPB corruption; mitigated by backup creation in scripts.
Assumptions: Assumes VIPB file exists at Tooling/deployment/seed.vipb.
Constraints: VIPB SHALL be valid XML; backup created before modification.
Verification Detail: Inspection: verify agent documents VIPB modification scripts.

Requirement Statement: The ollama-executor agent SHALL document the capability to trigger a real LabVIEW source distribution build after VIPB modification using Build_Source_Distribution.ps1.
Acceptance Criteria: Agent documentation includes source distribution build command with version and bitness parameters following VIPB modification.
Agent Procedure (step-by-step): Review agent markdown for build triggering section showing Build_Source_Distribution.ps1 usage.
Evidence to Collect: Agent markdown excerpt showing build command after VIPB modification.
Notes: Documents build triggering after VIPB configuration.
Rationale: Enables agent to complete the build workflow end-to-end.
Risk: Risk: build fails if LabVIEW not installed; mitigated by prerequisite documentation.
Assumptions: Assumes Windows runner with matching LabVIEW version installed.
Constraints: LabVIEW SHALL be installed and licensed on the build machine.
Verification Detail: Inspection: verify agent documents Build_Source_Distribution.ps1 triggering.

Requirement Statement: The ollama-executor agent SHALL document prerequisites for real LabVIEW builds including Windows runner and LabVIEW installation requirements.
Acceptance Criteria: Agent documentation includes important notes section listing Windows and LabVIEW installation requirements for real builds.
Agent Procedure (step-by-step): Review agent markdown for real build prerequisites section.
Evidence to Collect: Agent markdown excerpt showing real build prerequisites.
Notes: Documents prerequisites to prevent build failures on unsupported configurations.
Rationale: Prevents users from attempting real builds on incompatible systems.
Risk: Risk: users attempt builds without prerequisites; mitigated by clear documentation.
Assumptions: Assumes documentation clearly states Windows and LabVIEW requirements.
Constraints: Real builds cannot run on Linux/macOS or without LabVIEW.
Verification Detail: Inspection: verify agent documents real build prerequisites.

Requirement Statement: The ollama-executor agent SHALL be validated in simulation mode demonstrating end-to-end build workflow execution without real LabVIEW, producing stub artifacts and exit code 0.
Acceptance Criteria: Simulation mode test completes with exit code 0; stub artifacts are created when OLLAMA_SIM_CREATE_ARTIFACTS=true; log output shows [SIMULATION MODE ACTIVE] marker.
Agent Procedure (step-by-step): Run Test-SimulationMode.ps1 with OLLAMA_EXECUTOR_MODE=sim and verify all tests pass with artifacts created.
Evidence to Collect: Test output showing simulation mode execution with artifact creation and exit code 0.
Notes: Validates agent can drive builds in simulation mode for CI/testing.
Rationale: Enables testing of build workflow without LabVIEW installation.
Risk: Risk: simulation mode diverges from real behavior; mitigated by parallel testing.
Assumptions: Assumes Test-SimulationMode.ps1 covers key simulation scenarios.
Constraints: Simulation mode SHALL NOT invoke real LabVIEW processes.
Verification Detail: Test: run Test-SimulationMode.ps1 and verify all tests pass.

Requirement Statement: The ollama-executor simulation mode SHALL create stub artifacts under builds/source-distribution/ when OLLAMA_SIM_CREATE_ARTIFACTS=true.
Acceptance Criteria: Stub artifact zip file exists at builds/source-distribution/LabVIEW_Icon_Editor_SourceDist_LV<version>_<bitness>bit.zip with size > 0 bytes.
Agent Procedure (step-by-step): Run Build_Source_Distribution.ps1 with OLLAMA_EXECUTOR_MODE=sim and OLLAMA_SIM_CREATE_ARTIFACTS=true; verify artifact exists.
Evidence to Collect: Artifact path and size from test output.
Notes: Validates simulation mode creates expected artifacts for downstream testing.
Rationale: Enables verification of artifact handling in CI without real builds.
Risk: Risk: stub artifacts have wrong format; mitigated by format validation.
Assumptions: Assumes builds/source-distribution/ directory is created by simulation.
Constraints: Stub artifacts SHALL match naming convention for real artifacts.
Verification Detail: Test: verify stub artifact creation in simulation mode.

Requirement Statement: The ollama-executor simulation mode SHALL support simulated failure testing via OLLAMA_SIM_FAIL=true with configurable exit code via OLLAMA_SIM_EXIT.
Acceptance Criteria: When OLLAMA_SIM_FAIL=true, executor exits with code specified in OLLAMA_SIM_EXIT (default 1); stderr contains [SIMULATION MODE] Simulated Failure message.
Agent Procedure (step-by-step): Run Build_Source_Distribution.ps1 with OLLAMA_SIM_FAIL=true and OLLAMA_SIM_EXIT=42; verify exit code 42.
Evidence to Collect: Test output showing exit code 42 and simulated failure message.
Notes: Validates simulation mode can test failure handling paths.
Rationale: Enables testing of error handling without real failures.
Risk: Risk: false confidence if failure simulation incomplete; mitigated by exit code verification.
Assumptions: Assumes OLLAMA_SIM_FAIL and OLLAMA_SIM_EXIT are honored by executor.
Constraints: Simulated failures SHALL NOT leave partial state.
Verification Detail: Test: verify simulated failure with custom exit code.

Requirement Statement: The ollama-executor simulation mode SHALL support cross-platform testing for multiple LabVIEW version/bitness combinations (LV2021-32, LV2021-64, LV2025-32, LV2025-64).
Acceptance Criteria: Simulation runs complete for all four version/bitness combinations with execution time < 200ms each and exit code 0.
Agent Procedure (step-by-step): Run Test-SimulationMode.ps1 cross-platform test section; verify all four combinations complete successfully.
Evidence to Collect: Test output showing all four combinations with timing and exit codes.
Notes: Validates simulation mode works for all supported LabVIEW configurations.
Rationale: Enables matrix testing of version/bitness combinations in CI.
Risk: Risk: some combinations not tested; mitigated by explicit matrix in test.
Assumptions: Assumes simulation mode accepts all valid version/bitness values.
Constraints: Supported versions: 2021-2025; bitness: 32 or 64.
Verification Detail: Test: verify cross-platform simulation for all version/bitness combinations.

Requirement Statement: The ollama-executor agent SHALL document the capability to use the Seed Docker container (ghcr.io/labview-community-ci-cd/seed:latest) for VIPB modification.
Acceptance Criteria: Agent documentation includes Seed Docker container usage for VIPB modification with vipb2json and json2vipb commands.
Agent Procedure (step-by-step): Review agent markdown for Seed Docker section showing container commands.
Evidence to Collect: Agent markdown excerpt showing Seed Docker commands for VIPB modification.
Notes: Documents Seed Docker container for cross-platform VIPB modification.
Rationale: Enables VIPB modification on any platform without LabVIEW installation.
Risk: Risk: Docker image unavailable; mitigated by local build instructions.
Assumptions: Assumes Docker is installed and accessible.
Constraints: Seed container runs on Linux; host volume mounting required.
Verification Detail: Inspection: verify agent documents Seed Docker container usage.

Requirement Statement: The ollama-executor agent SHALL document the vipb2json CLI tool from Seed container for converting VIPB to JSON format.
Acceptance Criteria: Agent documentation includes vipb2json command syntax with --input and --output parameters.
Agent Procedure (step-by-step): Review agent markdown for vipb2json command usage.
Evidence to Collect: Agent markdown excerpt showing vipb2json command.
Notes: Documents vipb2json tool for VIPB to JSON conversion.

Assumptions: Assumes VIPB file is valid XML format.
Constraints: Output JSON is human-readable for editing.
Verification Detail: Inspection: verify agent documents vipb2json command.

Requirement Statement: The ollama-executor agent SHALL document the json2vipb CLI tool from Seed container for converting JSON back to VIPB format.
Acceptance Criteria: Agent documentation includes json2vipb command syntax with --input and --output parameters.
Agent Procedure (step-by-step): Review agent markdown for json2vipb command usage.
Evidence to Collect: Agent markdown excerpt showing json2vipb command.
Notes: Documents json2vipb tool for JSON to VIPB conversion.

Requirement Statement: The ollama-executor agent SHALL document the full list of Seed CLI tools (vipb2json, json2vipb, lvproj2json, json2lvproj, buildspec2json, json2buildspec).

Requirement Statement: The ollama-executor agent SHALL document how to build the Seed Docker image locally from Tooling/seed/Dockerfile.
Acceptance Criteria: Agent documentation includes docker build command for local Seed image creation.
Agent Procedure (step-by-step): Review agent markdown for Seed image build instructions.

Requirement Statement: The ollama-executor agent SHALL document that VIPB modification via Seed Docker can be done on any platform (Windows/macOS/Linux) while actual LabVIEW builds require Windows.
Acceptance Criteria: Agent documentation includes note about cross-platform VIPB modification and Windows-only build requirement.
Agent Procedure (step-by-step): Review agent markdown for platform requirements section.
Evidence to Collect: Agent markdown excerpt showing platform requirements.
Notes: Documents platform requirements for different workflow stages.
Rationale: Clarifies which operations can be done cross-platform.
Risk: Risk: users attempt builds on wrong platform; mitigated by clear documentation.

Constraints: LabVIEW builds require Windows with LabVIEW installed.
Verification Detail: Inspection: verify agent documents platform requirements.
